metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45095 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
pep_sock_accept in net/phonet/pep.c in the Linux kernel through 5.15.8 has a refcount leak. It was discovered that the Phone Network protocol (PhoNet) implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform reference counting in some error conditions. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-aws - 4.4.0-1102.107
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-azure - 4.15.0-1134.147~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-azure - 4.15.0-1134.147~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.107').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1134.147~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1134.147~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1').
